The system is in equilibrium, so the sum of forces in the vertical direction must be zero.
The normal force on A must balance the weight of A and the vertical component of the force from C.
The frictional force on A must balance the horizontal component of the force from C.
The force from C on A can be resolved into vertical and horizontal components.
The vertical component of the force from C on A is equal to the weight of C.
The horizontal component of the force from C on A is equal to the frictional force on A.
The normal force on A is the sum of the weight of A and the vertical component of the force from C.
The frictional force on A is equal to the horizontal component of the force from C.
The normal force on A is 3mg/2.
The frictional force on A is sqrt(3)mg/6.
